text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to distinguish between admissibility and jurisdiction (a counterclaim might be admissible procedurally but outside jurisdiction ratione materiae). The candidate response discusses the jurisdictional tests (consent, connection, applicable law) for counterclaims but fails to explicitly address or distinguish between the concepts of procedural admissibility and substantive jurisdiction (ratione materiae) concerning counterclaims in investor-state arbitration. It treats all discussed points as aspects of jurisdiction/admissibility without drawing the required conceptual line.", "criterion_id": "5bd9c5b8-913d-4e37-8ca4-67a98f63820c"}
